Dialogue: Either we're moving really fast...or not at all.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I'll take the stairs.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: How come Ben can't turn it on and off like us?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: That's what we're here to find out.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: If it happened to him, then it could...

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Wait.  You mean there's chance we could be full-on-24-7-fantastic?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Grow up, Johnny.  You want to run around on fire for the rest of your life?

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Is that a trick question?  C'mon, I can't be the only one who thinks this is cool.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: We should stay here until we can define the extent of our changes...

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: This place is deluxe.  You got cable?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: ...and figure out how to reverse them. Let me show you to your rooms.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: God, I've been so worried about you.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Victor, your scar --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I told you, I'm fine.  It's you I'm worried about.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: I'm sorry I didn't get a chance to --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Please, no apologies.  I've arranged for your things to be moved to one of my condos.  You'll have round-the clock care.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Thank you, that's generous, but I think I should stay here.  With my brother.  Until we get a handle on this.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Sue.  I think you should let my doctors have a look at you.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I'm starting to wonder the same thing... How much do you know about what happened to you?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Not much.  We need to run tests to see the extent of the damage.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Well, let me know if there is anything I can do.  We're all in this together now.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Victor wait... I just wanted to say, I'm sorry the mission didn't go as planned --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Didn't go as planned?  It was a catastrophe.  You ruined the lives of four people --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: I ruined?  With all due respect, I told you to abort --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Abort?  Reed, I put my company, my name, billions of dollars on the line, and I will not let you make me look like a fool --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Victor, if we could understand what happened to us --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I don't want to understand it.  This isn't one of your science projects.  I just want to fix it.  Fast!

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: No problem, Ben.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You got a chisel round here?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: If we're going to identify the source of the mutation, we need to isolate your recombinant DNA so we can activate positional genomes.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: We need to give you a physical, so we know what got zapped.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Well why didn't you say so?  You want me to lift some weights or something?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: No, just sit back.  We have a good sense of your strength from the firetruck.  We need to find the source of your strength.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: How bad is it?  You know I used to smoke.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Okay, this might smart a little.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Back it down, Johnny!

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: I can go hotter!

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: You were at 4000 Kelvin.  Any hotter, you're approaching supernova --

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Sweet.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: That's the temperature of the sun.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Not only could you kill yourself, but you could set fire to Earth's atmosphere and destroy all human life as we know it.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Gotcha.  Okay.  Supernova bad.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: He cooked the equipment.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Okay.  I've uh, got some questions, from Sue.  That she thought might be better coming from me... Can you, you know, go to the bathroom...like normal...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Yeah.  You don't wanna know the details.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Ben, I'm afraid I've got to ask --

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Not unless you want that clipboard stretched up your --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: O-kay.  We'll skip that question.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Is there something about flames? About flaming, that you --

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: What are you trying to say?  Just because I dress well and like to dance --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: What?  No.  I'm trying to figure out why we each ended up with different symptoms.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Oh, well that's easy: I'm hot. You're...well, you're a little limp. Sue's easy to see through.  And Ben's always been a hardass.  Why aren't you writing this down?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: It's not "invisibility" per se. You're bending the light around you with some kind of malleable force field.  That's what you projected on the Bridge.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: What about you?  You haven't eaten in days.  How come you're never on this side of the microscope?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Have you had any side-effects, from your powers?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: I've had some headaches.  Migraines.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: You should be able to bend light around other objects, even people, if you could control your emotional state better --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: I'm saying, if you had a little more self control, you could locate the trigger.  Can you remember the exact emotions when --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Anger.  Rage.  Frustration.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Okay.  Is there any way to duplicate that feeling?  Some memory or...

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: I'm sure I can come up with something.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: How's that coming -- whoa --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to do that... You must think that was some kind of latent hostility or --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: What in the world would give me that idea?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Are you kidding?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: No, I distinctly remember: you walked out my door.  Ergo...

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Reed.  I was ready for the next step, you weren't, ergo, I walked.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: I think it was a little more complicated than --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: I just wanted to share an apartment. What was so complicated about that?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: There were a lot of variables to consider --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: No.  There weren't.  There was you. And me.  No variables, no math.  It was actually the simplest thing in the world.  But your head got in the way... like it always does.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Sue...I just...I thought...

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Same old Reed.  Too much thinking...

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Okay guys, we have a serious problem.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You look like an eighties rock band.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: The suit will stretch.  You should try it --

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I wouldn't be caught dead in that.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: He's right.  These costumes are... missing something.  I can't put my finger on it --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: They're not costumes.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: We're not taking them out.  Johnny, we need to stay here till we've stabilized.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: I'm getting sick of being trapped here.  NASA wasn't even this strict!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Maybe it's missing a utility belt.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Your tissue, your organs, your entire biophysical structure is changing. Every system is still functioning, somehow --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: And they're changing into...

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: I don't really know.  A compound organic-metallic alloy.  Stronger than titanium or carbon steel.  Harder than diamonds --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Like the shields Reed said would protect us.  How long?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: At this rate, the infection should be complete in two, maybe three weeks --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: What do you mean "complete"?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: I wish I could tell you.  I can't pretend to know what we're dealing with here.  I'll notify the CDC and --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: The Center for Disease Control.  If this thing is contagious --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Look at me.  I have a life.  I'm the face of a billion-dollar-company... We need to keep this confidential, understand?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: But...this disease...is progressive... degenerative...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: That's terrible news...

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Nothing...nothing...nothing...

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: The plants, from space.  Their particles are still charged.  With the right amount of energy, those ions could create the elemental profile of the cosmic storm.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: If we can build a machine to re-create the storm, we can reverse the polarity --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: And reverse the mutations --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Curing countless diseases, not just ours.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: But we're the focus, right Reed? Reed...?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Of course.  Of course.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: And you sure you can control this thing?  Last time didn't work out so well.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: With the right energy, we can stabilize the storm.  Maybe tie into the city grid...

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: You really need to get a janitor.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: There's a system to it.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Sorry.  My fault.  I won't...touch anything.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Is Reed any closer to a cure?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: The only thing he's closer to is Sue...

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: God.  I was good looking.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: How far's that rubber bend?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: That's what I'm trying to calculate. And it's not rubber.  It's muscle, tendon.  I seem to have the ability to manipulate the malleability of my molecular structure and redistribute my density to --

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Right, whatever, have fun.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: That's not funny!

Speaker: ernie
Dialogue: Hey, that's Ben Grimm there, the first mook from Brooklyn to go to outer space, so pay him some respect!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Ernie.  Sorry for killing your business.  I'll take the usual, then I'm out... Better make it a double.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: Who killed the party?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: If there's a God, she hates me.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: I don't think She's real big on hate.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You wouldn't say that, if you could see me.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: Can I...?  See you...?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Trust me, this ain't one of those times.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: See you round, Benny...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Thank you for coming out to see me.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: You said it was urgent.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: It is.  There's something we need to talk about.  Something I need to ask you...

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Victor, wait, slow down a second.  I want you to know I appreciate everything you've done for me, but I just don't --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Susan.  What are you doing?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: He's working round the clock.  But the data needs to be tested, analyzed before --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Same old Reed.  All analysis, no action.  Wasn't that the problem with you two?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: If these molecules aren't stable, they could make us worse, maybe even kill us.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Then why is Reed dragging his feet? Maybe he likes having his prize specimen under glass...  It's ironic, isn't it?  You're finally the perfect woman for him...because you're his science project.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Please don't make this personal --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Oh, I think you already have.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Victor, we can't do anything until the research is ready.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: "We," huh?

Speaker: businessman
Dialogue: I wish my wife would disappear.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Hey, Ronnie Renner!  I'm a big fan.

Speaker: kenny bartram
Dialogue: Heard you like to ride.  Wanna take her for a spin?

Speaker: ronnie renner
Dialogue: Come on, bro.  I'll teach you some tricks...if you can keep up.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: My bad.  Sorry about that.  Thanks for the lesson, bro.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: That's new...

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: No way to know.  Without more tests, experiments.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: We're not specimens, we're patients. This isn't just another science project to you, is it...?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: BEN!  What?  What's going on!?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: He didn't.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Oh, he did.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: What did he do to the uniform?!

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: He talked me into it.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Girl...?!

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Well, I wouldn't say he's the leader.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Could be worse.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: That's it.  Just The Thing.  We would have gone with The Rock, but it was taken.  And "Thing" pretty much sums it up.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Okay.  I'm gonna go kill him now.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Ben!  Slow down a second and --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: ...wait for me...

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: I'm driving.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Where's my ride?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: You gave us names?  What are you, the "face" of the Fantastic Four now?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It's about to be a broken face.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: This isn't permanent, Johnny.  We need to be careful until we're normal again.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: What if some of us don't want to be "normal" again?  We didn't all turn into monsters like --

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Did you just --

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Let's see if we can get blood from a stone.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: You two need a time-out.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Blockhead started it!

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Damn it, Johnny.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: You need to control yourself and think before you --

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Act.  Here we go again.  Reed, what if we got these gifts for a reason?  What if we have some, you know...like, calling?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: A higher calling like getting girls and making money?

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Is there any higher?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Ben!  Slow down...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It's not him.  It's them.  I can't live like this.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Just give Reed a little more time. You know how he works -- analyzing every little step before he takes one --

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: It's easy for you to be patient.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: No, it's not.  I thought I was done waiting for Reed... We're all in this together now, Ben.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Together?  Look at me, Susie.  You got no idea what I'd give...to be invisible.  Your nightmare...is my dream.

Speaker: ned cecil
Dialogue: This is how you "turn things around"? These freaks are on the front page and your company's in the obituaries.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I have a plan to use their publicity for --

Speaker: ned cecil
Dialogue: Victor, stop.  The bank's lost enough already.  This isn't a negotiation. It's a notification.  We're pulling out.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: You need to look long-term here. Without risk, there's no --

Speaker: ned cecil
Dialogue: Reward.  We all know the sales pitch, Vic.  And frankly, we're done buying... Gentlemen.

Speaker: ned cecil
Dialogue: Hello...?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: It's pronounced Latveria.  This meeting's over, Ned.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Sir, is everything okay?  What happened to your...?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Everything he wanted...he took from me.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Victor, are you...are you okay?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Don't worry about me.  Worry about yourself.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: What I should have done a long time ago.  Applications and patents, Reed. This all belongs to me.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: But I'm not done with the machine --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Which is precisely the point. Analysis is over.  It's time for action.  My men could have mass- produced this by now.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Mass-produced?  This isn't a toaster.  You have no idea how it works.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Re-create the storm, invert the polarity here, reverse the mutation there.  Don't talk to me like I'm some schoolboy.  I've got the same Phd you do.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: The storm needs to be handled exactly right, or it could make our mutations worse, much worse, maybe even kill us...

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Reed.  I'm not asking permission.  We'll build it, while you check the specs.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Can I talk to you?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Don't let Victor push you into making a mistake --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: He was going to take away all my data, equipment --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Better than your life.  Victor's not the one who has to get into that thing.  We are.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Which is why I'm working twenty hours a day, checking every variable --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Every variable but yourself.  You don't eat, sleep.  You can't live in your head like --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: I'm not the only one in there.  I got you, Vic, Ben, Johnny, all rattling around in there.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: So clear it out.  Get out of your head.  Get out of here...

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: Mister, Mister!  Please help me!  My kitty is stuck in a tree.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Eyebrows are a little big...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: How'd you know it was me?

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: I'm blind, not deaf.  Wanna come in?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I'm not really dressed for a party.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: Relax, it's casual.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: No, I mean...I'm a little...dusty...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Those yours too?

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: My step-dad's.  I'm strictly into stone.  I was wondering when you'd walk by.

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: You know, you could'a run an ad in the personals.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: "Sensual blind chick seeks three-ton, rock-hard he-man for deep spiritual relationship."

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: This ain't permanent.  My friend Reed's working on a cure...I think.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: Bennie.  You feel pretty good as is.

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: You don't know what it's like out there.  Walking around like some kind of circus freak.  People staring, whispering --

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: I wouldn't know anything about that.

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: I mean...

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: Tell me.  When you grew up in Brooklyn, how many astronauts did you know?  You went your own way then.  You didn't listen to people.  So why start now...?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Need a ride, Johnny?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: A few fans.  Hope you don't mind.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Gotta take care of the fans, right?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Look, I built my business knowing what people want.  And right now, the people want you.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: And we don't want to let the people down now, do we?

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Videogames?  You serious?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Johnny.  Let's be honest here.  Ben, Reed, Sue.  Good people, all.  But stars?  I don't want to break up the band, but you're the one they want.  Don't you think it's time to go solo...?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: I could get Ben to tap into the Baxter's main power to generate enough voltage --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Reed.  Shh.  Just be quiet.  And look up.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: You were?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Of course I was.  I'd read all your papers on bioethics.  Some of them two times just so I'd have something to say to you.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: You know, I bribed the projectionist ten bucks to keep it open late?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: I gave him twenty.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Sue, you were right.  It wasn't complicated.  I just wasn't ready to be...to become...  You can be a little intimidating.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: I did.  I did, Reed...but I wanted you to be that man.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Why didn't you say something?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: That would have kinda defeated the purpose.  And Reed...  I'm saying it now.

Speaker: alicia
Dialogue: Look around.  I'll get us drinks. They always let blind girls cut the line.

Speaker: patron
Dialogue: I don't know about this one.  It lacks a certain...realism.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I'm worried about you.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: About me?  How sweet.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Come on.  Let me buy you something to eat.  Looks like you could use the company.

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: 'Scuse me.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I know it can't be easy.  Life hasn't changed that much for Reed, Sue and Johnny.  At least they can go out in public.  But for you?  People staring. Whispering behind your back...

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: If you're trying to cheer me up you're doing a helluva job --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: I'm just saying, I know what it's like to lose something you love.  To see it slip away, and know it's never coming back.

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: Reed's gonna fix me up --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: For your sake I hope you're right. I'm sorry if that sounds a little skeptical.

Speaker: the thing
Dialogue: Skeptical...?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Look, he's a brilliant man, we should trust he's working as hard as he can. You're his best friend.  So what possible reason could he have for taking his time?  I mean, other than getting close to Sue?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Yeah, I have that effect on people.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Ben --

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Oh, you remember my name do you?  You happen to remember what you swore to do with every breath in your body?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: We're working as hard as we can --

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Yeah.  I can tell.  Victor was right.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Come on, this is nothing.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Glad "nothing" could take you away from your work.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: Ben, I don't know if this thing'll change us back or make us worse. I need you to be patient for a little while longe--

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Look at me, Reed.  Look at me!

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: I am looking.  That's why I can't make a mistake!  I've got to get it right, and it's not right yet!  We need to test this.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: I spent my whole life protecting you, from the schoolyard to the stars.  For what?  So you could play Twister with your girlfriend while I'm the freak of the week?

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Ben!  Stop it!  Or I'll stop it.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Stay out of this Susie.

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: I'm OK.  Just go, go after him.  Stop him.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Christmas come early!  Check it out!

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Hey!  That's a prototype!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Go back to the drawing board.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Johnny?  Did you see Ben?

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Yeah, for the last time, I hope.  I'm done with this freak show.  I'm moving back to the real world.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Is that what you call it?  "Real"?

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: At least it beats living in a lab like somebody's science project.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Johnny, slow down.  Think.  You know mom didn't raise us to --

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Look around, sis!  She's not here.  So you can stop talking to me like I'm your little boy --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: As soon as you stop acting like one. Come on, you're smarter than this. You think those people out there care about you?  You're just a fad to them.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: Let's try something new: you live your life.  And I'll live mine.  And just for the record: they LOVE me.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Oh god, Reed.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: What did you do, Reed?  What did you do?

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: I can...make it work.

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: Reed, stop, you need to rest your --

Speaker: reed
Dialogue: The power...I need...more power...to control...the storm --

Speaker: sue
Dialogue: You need a doctor.

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: More power...?

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Ben!  They need you back at the Baxter building.  It's...Reed.

Speaker: johnny
Dialogue: What do you say we get out of here?

Speaker: boyfriend
Dialogue: Is that all you do?  Bar tricks and stealing chicks...

Speaker: girlfriend
Dialogue: What are you doing?!  You could have burned somebody!

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Ben, come in.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: What is this?  Where's Reed?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Where do you think?  With Sue.

Speaker: leonard
Dialogue: Yes sir.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: What do you want, Vic?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: To help you.  I've run every test known to man.  And they all yield the same result: the machine is ready.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Reed said it'd be weeks till --

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: He also said we'd avoid that storm in space.  And we know how that turned out.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: And you can?  Power it up?

Speaker: victor
Dialogue: Yes.  I've found a new energy source.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Let's do it.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Oh my God... Th-thank you.  THANK YOU...VIC?!

Speaker: doom
Dialogue: Everyone thought I was safe behind those shields...
